reviews.text:
This is not really a must go destination, in all honesty we were only in this cool little park as we were wandering around in the neighbourhood on a glorious and roasting hot Friday afternoon, we cut through this park and chilled out on a bench checking on our phones places of interest close by.
It's a relaxing area,despite its central location, nice well kept grounds,a statue and limited seating but I enjoyed my time here fleeting as it was.
Easy to locate on Avenida Pau Casals.

If you happen to be in the neighborhood, this little park is a nice place to rest a bit in between the runs to the many attractions of Barcelona. It has a nice little lake with banks of red fish, shadow, a few benches and even a little terrace where you can get a refreshment. It's not a destination in itself, though probably the residents in the area enjoy it a lot in the evening.
It's a regular park, not so big, and locals use to take their dogs, kids, and sometimes they do some jogging there. Not so good to make a picnic, if it's a sunny day you could take a sandwich there.
